name: SubCellBarCode
description: A collection of resources (including methodologies, tools, and data) centred around deducing and exploring the subcellular localisation of proteins.

name: SciLifeLab RDM Guidelines Portal
description: A web portal that contains information relevant for the management of life science research data in Sweden. Guidance is given for each phase of the data life cycle, and users can also receive direct support from the associated Helpdesk.

name: SciLifeLab Data Repository
description: Repository for publishing any kind of research-related data, e.g. documents, figures, or presentations. Powered by Figshare.

name: SciLifeLab Data Stewardship Wizard
description: Tool to aid the creation of research data management plans. Allows to create a data management plan by answering a number of multiple-choice questions.

name: SciLifeLab Serve
description: Tool allowing to host and share R Shiny apps, Dash apps as well as trained machine learning models (Tensorflow and PyTorch serving).

name: The Swedish COVID-19 & Pandemic Preparedness Data Portal
description: Portal devoted to data and resources relevant to COVID-19 and pandemic preparedness research in Sweden.

name: SweFreq
description: The Swedish Frequency resource for genomics (SweFreq) is a website developed to make genomic datasets more findable and accessible in order to promote collaboration, new research and increase public benefit.

name: SciLifeLab Data Management helpdesk
description: Researchers at Swedish academic institutions working in life sciences can get support with research data management (RDM) questions: RDM plans, reproducibility, FAIR, human data publication, etc.

name: SciLifeLab Data Delivery System
description: Cloud-based system for the delivery of data from SciLifeLab units to their users. It consists of a command line interface (CLI) and a currently minimal web interface.

name: Order Portal
description: A web-based system to enable communication between units and prospective users. We can provide you with an instance configured according to your own specific requirements.

name: Anubis
description: Anubis is a web-based system for handling calls, proposal submission, reviews, decisions, and grant dossiers.
